title: Cannot Dismiss Reminders GMail Calendar
creator: aperkinsva7arp
content:
Hello, currently I cannot dismiss calendar events on my GMail calendar within Thunderbird. I am being prompted every twenty minutes about an event from last week. The Dismiss and Dismiss All buttons on the reminder form do nothing.

I am using Thunderbird 128.4.0esr (64-bit). The calendar is set up through Provider for Google Calendar version 128.0.0.

(Doing nothing is an improvement over the built-in calendar, which threw an error message every time instead).

This seems to be a persistent problem many users have encountered over the years, judging by past support requests from people with the same issue. Is there any way to dismiss these notifications? If not I will be uninstalling Thunderbird and finding a different email client.

title: Lost all my saved Thunderbird folders and files
creator: kmckay23
content:
In late September, IONOS canceled me--they blamed their new algorithm. They also deleted or uninstalled my Thunderbird at the same time--they deny doing it. I reinstalled T-bird and downloaded my current inbox from webmail, but 25+ years of work and personal email files saved in Local Folders were missing, along with my address book. Carbonite recovered >130GB of T-bird files that I think and hope are my saved files and put them in one big folder on my desk top--hours later, Hurricane Helene hit. I have my replacement computer now and a recovery drive from Carbonite with>450G of my data on it, including my earlier recovered Thunderbird files.

Question: how do I get those files and address book back into my Thunderbird? This is critical for me. I'm a writer, and all my professional communications are in them, along with all my volunteer work and personal messages--more than 25 years' worth! Between the hurricane and this, I've lost more than a month of work already as well as contacts, medical records, etc..
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:132.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/132.0

Als ik Thunderbird opnieuw installeer dan worden nieuwe emails direct zichtbaar en gaat de imap sync weer een tijdje goed, maar dat telkens opnieuw installeren is natuurlijk geen echte oplossing.

content:
From : rony mesken, toni depape

rm@mic.be  ; tdp@mic.be

thunderbird version 2024 - toolbar customization: missing: "delete" and "junk"

Dear ,

we send a note as i handle average day, some 1000 emails in thunderbird.

for handling this , we use thunderbird last 10 years, where as the mail toolbar is:

previous - next - (delete ) - (junk )

In all versions up to 2023 , we would install above 4 (four ) settings on one line after each other.

In the new version from 2024 , the settings between: ( ) , are no longer in the main possibilies, but

we must use these settings on the line under; which takes far more time than all on one line.

Is it possible to have the ( ) settings, in the next new version , back again , like before ??

Nice greetings,

rony meskens

rm@mic.be or rm@micetap.com

title: Large profiles - export/move problems
creator: steve657
content:
Long time thunderbird user but kinda at my wits end. I'm moving to a new laptop and I have noted that the export function does not like profiles larger than 2Gb. Mine is approx 10.5Gb. I followed what seems to be the suggested protocol

- install on new machine, don't create any account, close thunderbird - erase the profile folder and the profile.ini in the new install (I guess this is optional really) - close thunderbird on old machine - copy the protocol and .ini files from old machine to the new one. (there is only 1 file: 1rrz6vdm.default which 

     seems odd maybe?)

- crank up the new thunderbird

Well, I get something, but basically it is a pale ghost of what is there in my old machine. Have tried dozens of variants on this process with no love.

Help? Thanks
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/130.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;solver_id:6263660

title: Mail bombing e passaggio da account POP3 a IMAP
creator: raffaelaragucci64
content:
Ciao a tutti. Questa mattina ho aperto la casella di posta, che non aprivo da ieri 2 Novembre e ho trovato più di 20.000 email di un virus, credo che mi stava bombardando, mandandomi completamente in crash la casella di posta. Nel frattempo, mentre cercavo di accedere e risolvere questa situazione siamo arrivati a più di 50.000 email da parte di questo indirizzo e altri. La cosa immediata che sono riuscita a fare è stato applicare un filtro, dove ogni nuova email veniva reindirizzata direttamente nel cestino. Però questo non ha smesso di farmi ricevere email, e soprattutto continuava a farmi crashare Thunderbird. Solo questo pomeriggio sono riuscita ad accedere alla mia casella di posta Aruba web per bloccare il mittente e solo a quel punto hanno smesso di inviarmi email, anche se stanno ricominciando da altri indirizzi. Ora ci sono due problemi principali (tre contando quello appena descritto): 1. una volta bloccato il mittente sono andata a controllare che fosse tutto ok e mi sono accorta che mi mancano più di sei mesi di posta in arrivo, non so come fare essendo che queste email sono molto importanti visto che sopra ho il mio account lavorativo. 2. sto cercando di cambiare account da POP3 a IMAP essendo che non riesco a vedere le mail su altri server, ma seguendo esattamente tutti i passaggi non riesco a farlo, mi butta fuori a un certo punto. ci ho provato più di dieci volte.

Ora l'opzione che sto valutando è quella di andare via, a malincuore, da Thunderbird per affidarmi a un server di posta più sicuro e intuitivo, soprattutto perché non è la prima volta che mi da problemi. Ma anche qui ho dei problemi in quanto non saprei come poter trasferire anni di email in un altro server senza perderne alcuna.

Sono consapevole del fatto che siano tante informazioni e tanti problemi, ai miei occhi insormontabili, per questo vi chiedo aiuto. Grazie mille Raffaela
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/130.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
